snippet.title: Pope Francis and the long shadow of Argentina's "Dirty War''
snippet.description: In 1974, when the Rev. Jorge Bergoglio was the top Jesuit in his native Argentina, a former nightclub dancer named Isabel Peron came to head the nation â€” an accidental and weak president.

snippet.title: Israel-Gaza: Peace begins with President Obama [Daybook]
snippet.description: THINK TANKED | The rundown on the day's think tank events.

snippet.title: Catholic schools seek to adapt
snippet.description: For schools everywhere, shifting demographics and dwindling enrollment can pose a major challenge. Some local suburban Catholic schools have learned that they must adapt to such changes -- or face closure.

snippet.title: How To Get Rid of Moths
snippet.description: Q How can I get rid of small brown moths that are eating my wool carpet? I have tried vacuuming frequently and spreading moth flakes on the carpet, hoping this would work while we were away for a week, but I am still seeing a few moths. This has been going on for several months. As the carpet is ...

snippet.title: How Virginia Saved America, and Why Feb. 2 Should Be a Holiday
snippet.description: It is one of the most important dates in U.S. history, yet probably no more than a handful of people understand its significance. Everyone who cares about the Bill of Rights should know what happened on that day.

snippet.title: Dragons Building Something Special
snippet.description: The attractive glass case at Glenelg Country School's new gymnasium holds many trophies, but none for boys' basketball. That might change this season.
